common_issues.title: Onboarding Issues in Pieces for Developers
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the onboarding process in Pieces for Developers, including blank demo chats, failure to generate onboarding pieces, and 'Context Exceeded' errors. These issues may stem from problems with VM setups, local database errors, or conflicts with specific Pieces versions. Proposed solutions involve resetting Pieces, deleting specific folders, and restarting the application. Some issues are under investigation or planned for resolution in future releases.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Hra42 reported that their chat history disappeared after restarting pOS and PfD.

**Key points raised:**

* User experienced chat history loss after restarting pOS and PfD.
* Included screenshots to illustrate the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Demo conversations were not properly created, leading to empty chats.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces will investigate the issue and attempt to replicate it.
* Hra42 provided additional information about their VM setup for further analysis.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation. 
* No solution has been implemented yet.


**Additional Notes:**

* The user provided links to related issues and helpful resources.
* The Pieces support bot provided an initial response and suggested helpful resources.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue where onboarding snippets and conversations were not generated after completing the onboarding process.
* The issue was identified as a bug related to deleting the local database but not the com.pieces.pfd folder.
* This bug caused a PERMISSION_DENIED error when accessing the Pieces cloud services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The following solution was proposed:
    * Close pOS and PfD.
    * Delete the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folders.
    * Restart pOS and then PfD.
* It is unclear whether this solution was implemented or not, as the conversation ends before confirmation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ends before the user confirms the outcome of the proposed solution.
* It is unclear whether the issue was resolved or not.

**Additional Information:**

* The user was identified as an existing user of Pieces.
* The conversation involved several Pieces team members, including @pieces-support-bot[bot], @mark-at-pieces, and @mack-at-pieces.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Andrea3i reports that the OS toolbar is not launching correctly, despite trying various methods.
* Sentry issues suggest a potential problem with the Visual Studio plugin's interaction with Pieces OS.
* The problem also affects applets and causes Pieces OS to restart unexpectedly.

**Problems Identified:**

* The OS toolbar and applets are not launching.
* Pieces OS restarts unexpectedly.
* The root cause of the issue is unknown due to limited error information.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix for Visual Studio plugin v3.0.1 to resolve UI thread hang.
* Changes to port selection in Pieces OS v10.1.15 for webview tool window integration.
* Debugging session scheduled with @Andrea3i to gather more information.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions did not resolve the issue for @Andrea3i.
* Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause, likely involving an OS error during applet hosting.
* A utility will be run to retrieve the OS error code for analysis.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is being treated with critical priority (P0).
* The conversation indicates ongoing collaboration between @Andrea3i and the Pieces team to resolve the problem.

related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## GitHub Issue Summary: Interface Bug on Small Screens

**Key Points:**

* User (@killerog) reported an interface bug on the Pieces onboarding process.
* This bug occurs on smaller screens, like a Macbook Air 11-inch, where a crucial next button is offscreen and inaccessible.
* The user was able to proceed by tabbing and clicking blindly.

**Problems:**

* Pieces doesn't adapt its onboarding interface for smaller screen sizes.
* This bug prevents users from completing the onboarding process.

**Solutions:**

* **Proposed:** Resize the window during onboarding (implemented in the next release).
* **Current workaround:** Tab and click blindly to find the next button.

**Outcome:**

* Issue marked as a duplicate of #470.
* Solution deployed in the next Pieces release.
* User requested to share system display size and resolution for further investigation.

**Status:**

* Open, awaiting release of the next version with the fix.
